name: Hotel Costabella

reviews.title: Great value and very helpful staff
reviews.text: Spent the weekend in this lovely city and the Hotel Costabella is a great base when visting Gerona. We had a quiet, comfortable room, at a very good price. The hotel has a wide range of faciltiies, I would expect that the pool is a real plus during the warmer months.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is excellent. A wide selection of fresh fruit, meats and local cheeses, cereal, tortillas and some tasty local rolls. The staff also give that extra effort in being helpful, which does make a difference.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel !!!!!!!!!
worth a visit
reviews.text: While it is a 10-15 min walk from the old city, parking is easy if you have a car.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay at the Costabella again, when flying into Gerona.
reviews.title: cool stay

likes.disliked: — distance from town, no shower curtain and uncomfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel - Excellent and friendly staff.
reviews.title: lovely breakfast

reviews.text: Thoroughly recommend this hotel. Not bad situation about 1 kilometer out of town from historical centre - about 15 min walk. Nice good size rooms with every amenity although droning noise from , perhaps, a generator, was annoying in our room , which was at end of corridor. Very nice buffet breakfast , incl. "healthy options" and coffee/tea available free during day in lobby. Very pleasant and helpful staff, and child friendly.
reviews.title: Nice good value hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on route from Barcelona to France. Booked a family room for 2 adults and 2 kids directly with Hotel. All e-mails answered quickly and the price beat all offers elsewhere. Room was actually 2 fully seperate rooms with 2 double beds, 2 tv's etc but with connecting door. Room was very high standard as was the service from reception Staff who were excellent and guided us into Girona via a very safe 10-15 minute walk. Buffet breakfast the next morning was superb with a huge choice of hot and cold food for all tastes and in lovely bright room. Kids enjoyed the outdoor pool the next morning which set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a very good hotel and a perfect stop off point between Barcelona and the South of France.
reviews.title: Made special by the staff rather than the location.

likes.liked: — The staff and the cleanliness of the whole hotel.
likes.disliked: — The location was a little too far out of the historic centre.

reviews.title: Loved the Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is a good place to stay if you don't mind the 15-20 minute walk to the sights, a little more to the train station. It's pretty flat though so not a problem for the mobile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were really helpful and friendly, and were able to give all sorts of useful advice, which really helped make the best of our long weekend.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a lovely city

reviews.text: The rooms are spotless, as is the rest of the hotel. Breakfast was a good spread, didn't have any evening meals at the hotel as there was so much to choose from in the town itself.
reviews.title: A Gem in Girona

reviews.text: A very pleasant hotel with helpful staff, good breakfast, relaxing pool area, free parking, and spacious family room.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: The best feature of the hotel was the pool which was always clean, never busy, good toilet and shower facilities and plenty of sun loungers. We were also impressed with the family room which had two separate bedrooms.
reviews.title: Great Place to Start Barcelona Trip Flying In on Ryan
Comfortable, non fussy
reviews.text: The hotel is located on one of the main roads into the city and easy to find on arrival. The heart of the city can be reached within a 20 minute stroll past a large hospital and a few supermarkets (not picturesque but we felt completley safe even late at night with two young kids). There are no bars or restaurants near the hotel but there's plenty to choose from in the city centre. We stayed for 3 nights and the whole family loved the city and the hotel. We will return and would recommend both to anyone. The hotel was a real find for us as good family accomodation is scarce - thank you trip advisor! If you have time to visit anywhere outside the city we would also recommend Banyoles. This has a beautiful lake with great facilities for swimming, cycling and boating. Another hit with the kids.

Following a day of endless travel, the stay at Costa Brava was a welcome find. We landed in Girona to secure the cheap flights to Barcelona and selected Girona as a great place to get our land legs in Spain before embarking on the trip. Great move!
reviews.title: Very good, but...
Great Value
reviews.text: Costa Brava is outside Girona, not really walking distance to the old town/city square but a great spot for the night: quiet, easy to access off the highway (n11) and fairly familiar surroundings; typical hotel. The room was a nice size, fine decor in the usual Spanish tones, excellent bath/shower, and with TV / Air. In the heat of August, this proves to be a winner. One of the benefits of the property if FREE internet access so one can connect with the outside world and tell everyone you arrived. Overall, just as everyone stated, a solid deal at 50 euros via Priceline.

reviews.title: nightmare
reviews.text: we arrived at girona aiport, and met two other couples, who were staying at the same hotel as us, we shared a taxi, and arrived at the hotel.we all were only staying for two nights, so we did not have long,to explore, we often nip over to girona, and never have we had any problems before, but i decided to use a different reservation centre, and have a change from our normal hotel, the costabella, always seemed to have good reviews. on arrival, the two couples who had booked two double rooms, were given one room, with two double beds in, and were told the hotel was full, so they could not put them anywhere else, time was getting on, normally we would be in our hotel room, and heading off to town, for 9pm, but that was not to be.then our turn, they said they did not think we were coming, and had tried to take money out of my account, with my card number which is held for security reasons, in case people dont turn up. i emailed them, saying what time we would arrive, and also the reservation center had my arrival times, which they would of passed on to the hotel, but they denied any knowledge.Then we were told, if the bed was two small, they would put a larger bed in there, we were given a single room, by now, you can imagine there were no words in the dictonary, to explain how i felt.In the end, they found 2 separate rooms, for the other two couples, and we had their room.I also took the receipts when they tried to get my money out of my card account, paid cash, and was told i could not have a receipt untill i left, mmmm! of course i did get some confirmation.another two couple also had problems, as evening meal did not take place, there was nothing even though avertised.and at the time,their website did not say it was non smoking, whether they have changed that now i dont know, but i will be writing to who ever is in charge of the hotel.

The hotel was great. The staff were friendly,the breakfast was fantastic (try the ring doughnuts and the freshly squeezed orange juice) and the left over cakes from breakfast were placed in the lobby for guests to take as many as they want.
reviews.title: felt like home

reviews.text: Also in the lobby were free tea and coffee making facilities-so you could make yourself a cuppa whenever.
reviews.title: Lucky find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very small and it felt like we were the the only guests there. on one occasion we were arond the pool at midday and nobody else was there.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very close to Girona's cathedral and many restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Air - con what a con!!!!

reviews.text: so if you want a short stay in Girona, stay here rather than a bigger hotel
reviews.title: Worth a visit
